text: James Melvin Newman (June 19, 1903 - February 13, 1963) was an Ontario merchant and political figure. He represented Rainy River in the Legislative Assembly of Ontario as a Liberal-Labour member from 1945 to 1951. He was born in Cartwright, Manitoba, the son of James Newman, and educated there. In 1928, he married Birdella Sweeney. Newman was an automobile dealer and farm implement distributor. He served on the town council for Fort Frances. He was also a member of the Masons and a Shriner. ==References== * Canadian Parliamentary Guide, 1947, GP Normandin == External links == * Category:1903 births Category:1963 deaths Category:Liberal-Labour Ontario MPPs Category:People from Fort Frances Category:People from Pembina Valley Region, Manitoba
title: James Newman (Canadian politician)
